sources.title: All The Fine Young Cannibals (1960)
sources.description: This rather obscure movie starring Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood and featuring jazz legend Pearl Bailey, had many parallels to the life of trumpeter Chet Baker. never released physically on video, was perhaps best known as the inspiration for the name of the 1980s pop group. Taken from a 1986 WTBS broadcast.

metadata.Plot: The minister of the town has died and his son Chad has no tears for him. Sarah, who now calls herself Salome, is pregnant with Chad's baby, but Chad has no future, no job and no money. Therefore, she leaves town on the train heading East. On the train she meets Tony who is heading back to Yale. Tony and his sister Catherine have one thing in common; they are both young, rich and bored with their lives. Salome goes to Yale with Tony and they are soon married, but she does not tell him about Chad or the pregnancy. Ruby takes Chad to New York where he plays trumpet and makes a name for himself. Catherine leaves school and moves in with Tony and Salome, creating tension between the young couple.
metadata.Actors: Robert Wagner, Natalie Wood, Susan Kohner
